Entities.Name: Tumor Stage
Entities.Definition: Pathological staging of prostate cancer post-surgery.

Sample Data.Sentence: The narratively written pathologic EHRs contained the following variable of interest: tumor stage (pT2a, pT2b, pT2c, pT3a, pT3b, pT4).
Sample Data.Annotated: Tumor Stage: pT2a, pT2b, pT2c, pT3a, pT3b, pT4

Entities.Name: Gleason Patterns
Entities.Definition: Classification of prostate cancer based on the Gleason score, indicating the aggressiveness of cancer cells.

Sample Data.Sentence: Primary and secondary Gleason patterns and corresponding percentages were noted as variables of interest.

Entities.Name: Surgical Margin
Entities.Definition: Indicates whether cancer cells were found at the edge of the tissue removed during surgery.

Sample Data.Sentence: Surgical margin statuses such as R0, RX, R1 were also key variables of interest.

Entities.Name: Prostate Specimen Volume
Entities.Definition: The volume of the prostate specimen removed during surgery.

Sample Data.Sentence: Included prostate specimen volume as a variable of interest.

Entities.Name: Nodal Stage
Entities.Definition: Classification of whether cancer has spread to nearby lymph nodes.

Sample Data.Sentence: Nodal stage was categorized as pN0, pNX, pN1.

Dataset.Name: Prostate Cancer Pathologic Database
Dataset.Details: Includes 3,679 RP electronic health records from a prostate cancer center, processed for detailed pathological information.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: The annotations were created by identifying parts of the EHR corresponding to the variables of interest, annotated semiautomatically using regular expressions based on expert input.
